article: My uncle has a very beautiful umbrella. He has had it for years and as he is very careful with it, it still looks as good as new. "That umbrella must have _ you a great deal of money, Uncle." I said to him one day. "No," he replied, " not a penny " "Was it a present?" I asked again. "No," said he. "Then how did you get it?" I asked. "Well," he answered, "it is a strange true story. About ten years ago, I was walking along a quiet London street one evening _ it suddenly rained. I had no raincoat and no umbrella. No buses ran through that street and there were no _ in sight. As I was on my way to a party, I didn't want to get _ . So I stood at a doorway and waited for the rain to stop. By and by it grew quite _ .There wasn't a person around, and _ it rained and rained. At last a young man came to the place where I was standing, _ a large umbrella over his head. _ I hoped he would _ me to walk to the next corner with him in order that I could get a taxi, I stepped out of the dark doorway where I had been standing, and said: " Excuse me , where are you going with that umbrella?" _ by my sudden appearance, the young man _ the umbrella, which, I'm afraid, he had just stolen, ran away, and _ into the darkness. I picked up the umbrella and continued my walk. I knew it would be _ in this big city to try and discover the owner and so I've kept it ever since ."
